articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Crispian Balmer, Philip Pullella
articles.description: Royalty, presidents, prime ministers and a legion of faithful will pay their last respects to Pope Francis on Saturday at a funeral Mass in St. Peter's Square to honour his sometimes turbulent papacy.
articles.title: Royalty and presidents to join multitude of mourners at Pope Francis' funeral

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Top Iranian and U.S. negotiators will meet again on Saturday to hammer out a new deal curbing Tehran's advancing nuclear programme, while U.S. President Donald Trump signalled confidence in clinching a new pact that would block Iran's path to a nuclear bomb.
articles.title: Iran, US to resume talks in Oman to narrow gaps over new nuclear deal

articles.author: Shivam Patel
articles.description: Indian and Pakistani troops exchanged gunfire for a second straight day on Saturday as ties plummeted between the two nuclear-armed neighbours after an attack on tourists blamed on Pakistani militants killed 26 in India's Kashmir region.
articles.title: India, Pakistan exchange gunfire for 2nd day as ties plummet after attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian and European officials pushed back this week against some U.S. proposals on how to end Russia's war in Ukraine, making counterproposals on issues from territory to sanctions, according to the full texts of the proposals seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Documents show differences over U.S. peace drive for Ukraine

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: U.S. officials arrested a Wisconsin judge on Friday and charged her with helping a man evade immigration authorities in what appeared to be a dispute between President Donald Trump's administration and local officials over immigration enforcement.
articles.title: US officials arrest Milwaukee judge for obstructing immigration operation

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Samuel Mckeith
articles.description: Giuffre was one of the first people to call for criminal prosecution against Epstein, which he eventually faced.
articles.title: Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre dies by suicide, her family says

articles.author: Andrew Silver, Trixie Yap, Gram Slattery
articles.description: China exempted some U.S. imports from its steep tariffs in a sign on Friday that the trade war between the two countries could be easing, though China quickly knocked down U.S. President Donald Trump's assertion that negotiations were underway.
articles.title: China waives tariffs on some U.S. goods, but denies Trump's claim that talks are underway

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Singapore has ordered Facebook parent Meta to block Singaporeans' access to posts made by foreigners, ahead of a national election under rules restricting their social media posts.
articles.title: Singapore orders foreigners' Facebook posts taken down under new election rules

articles.author: Jasper Ward
articles.description: The Trump administration appeared to have deported a 2-year-old U.S. citizen "with no meaningful process," a federal judge said on Friday, as the child's father sought to have her returned to the United States.
articles.title: Two-year-old US citizen appears to have been deported 'with no meaningful process'

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Syria has responded in writing to a list of U.S. conditions for possible partial sanctions relief, saying it had acted on most of them but others required "mutual understandings" with Washington, according to a copy of the letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syrian letter delivers response to US conditions for sanctions relief
